column4: Hi there.  I'm having a heck of a time linking an SMB share since the kernel upgrade to 2.6.20 the other day.  "ln -s smb://meumo/Music ~/Desktop/Music"  is now throwing the error "No such file or directory" (but I can browse to it through Nautilus with the same directory path).
I've chased a few possible solutions, but to no avail. Went so far as playing with cifs to see if that would work, but no-go
the smb:// only woks in nautilus
Mount throws the same error.  I tried smbmnt (part of smbfs), but to no avail their either
smbmount gives me the error "ERRDOS - ERRnoaccess. Session setup failed."
and anyways, you are trying to make a link from your linux box in to the win box so you can browse your linux box in your winbox. That's not the way to do it
No...I'm actually trying to make a link from the winbox to the Linux box so I can get rhythymbox to open it as a directory since it doesn't have the ability to grab it natively from SMB
If I were going the other way, I'd simply map the network drive in Windows to the UNC of the linux box
where is rhythmbox in your winbox or in your linuxbox
My linux box

There actually is not a winbox..they're both running Ubuntu, I was just unsuccessful getting NFS setup due to duplicate users on both machines.  The server is a webserver and my user has no shell access, so NFS was complaining about permissions I wasn't willing to change.  And on my laptop, I prefer to use the same username
what i would do is mount your share with smbmount
It throws the error I mentioned previously
what do you write on terminal
smbmount //meumo/Music ~/Desktop/music/
what about username and password
None necessary
sudo
btdt, still doesn't work. Same error.
smbmount was chmod'd to u+s anyway
sudo apt-get install smbfs
Already did..that's why smbmount/smbmnt/smbumount are installed and in place
i would try again
I have..multiple times.
